comments:
When running the JUnits against the i5 candidate build, I get an NPE in the SML Model Unit validation tests.  Here's the stack:

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.cosmos.rm.validation.internal.smlvalidators.SchemaValidator.validateSchema(SchemaValidator.java:218)
	at org.eclipse.cosmos.rm.validation.internal.smlvalidators.SchemaValidator.validateSchemas(SchemaValidator.java:154)
	at org.eclipse.cosmos.rm.validation.internal.smlvalidators.SchemaValidator.validate(SchemaValidator.java:65)
	at org.eclipse.cosmos.rm.repository.internal.operations.SMLMainValidator.validate(SMLMainValidator.java:268)
	at org.eclipse.cosmos.rm.repository.internal.operations.SMLMainValidator.start(SMLMainValidator.java:215)
	at org.eclipse.cosmos.rm.repository.internal.operations.FileValidateOperation.run(FileValidateOperation.java:198)
	at org.eclipse.cosmos.rm.repository.internal.operations.SMLMainValidator.main(SMLMainValidator.java:481)
	at org.eclipse.cosmos.rm.validation.internal.core.TestSMLModelUnits.validateSMLUnits(TestSMLModelUnits.java:94)
	at org.eclipse.cosmos.rm.validation.internal.core.TestSMLModelUnits.testAcyclicInvalidCycles(TestSMLModelUnits.java:106)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at junit.framework.TestCase.runTest(TestCase.java:164)
	at junit.framework.TestCase.runBare(TestCase.java:130)
	at junit.framework.TestResult$1.protect(TestResult.java:106)
	at junit.framework.TestResult.runProtected(TestResult.java:124)
	at junit.framework.TestResult.run(TestResult.java:109)
	at junit.framework.TestCase.run(TestCase.java:120)
	at org.eclipse.hyades.test.common.junit.HyadesTestCase.run(HyadesTestCase.java:172)
	at junit.framework.TestSuite.runTest(TestSuite.java:230)
	at org.eclipse.hyades.test.common.junit.HyadesTestSuite.runTest(HyadesTestSuite.java:457)
	at junit.framework.TestSuite.run(TestSuite.java:225)
	at org.eclipse.hyades.test.common.junit.HyadesTestSuite.doRun(HyadesTestSuite.java:425)
	at org.eclipse.hyades.test.common.junit.HyadesTestSuite.run(HyadesTestSuite.java:338)
	at org.eclipse.hyades.test.common.junit.HyadesTestRunner.run(HyadesTestRunner.java:504)
	at org.eclipse.hyades.test.java.runner.HyadesJUnitRunner.main(HyadesJUnitRunner.java:207)
I had failed to check in a file, so I had not noticed this problem in my own workspace.  FIXED in CVS HEAD.

David, are you suggesting that this exception is due to a user error ?
I am not sure what the missing file is but I assume it is an xsd or xml file referenced by the file you are trying to validate. In this case I would expect to see a nicer way to catch this exception so that the end user doesn't see this stack trace but rather an exception logged into the error view

It's not a user error.  It was my error for not checking in the file validation-resources/XMLSchema.xsd, so it did not get included in the build.  That said, it is probably useful to output a more informative message in the event that somehow that file fails to load as part of the schema validation process.
